metadata.title: CVE-2019-8355 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in SoX 14.4.2. In xmalloc.h, there is an integer overflow on the result of multiplication fed into the lsx_valloc macro that wraps malloc. When the buffer is allocated, it is smaller than expected, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow in channels_start in remix.c. It was discovered that SoX incorrectly handled certain MP3 files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2019-8354, CVE-2019-8355, CVE-2019-8356, CVE-2019-8357)

criterions.comment: sox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.2+git20190427-1').
